H0.text: Crossover occurs at different locations on a chromosome.

H1.text: At no locations does a crossover occur on a chromosome.

H2.text: Crossover occurs at one-two locations on a chromosome.

H3.text: A crossover occurs at the same location on a chromosome.

A4.text: Because there is a small probability of recombination at any location along a chromosome, the frequency of recombination between two locations depends on the distance separating them.

A5.text: The crossover process leads to offspring having different combinations of genes from those of their parents, and can occasionally produce new chimeric alleles.
